website_summaries.verdict: A thick tree wrap that is biodegradable, so you don't have to worry about removing it as the tree grows.
pros: A nice price for decent coverage (3 inches by 50 feet)
Has a waxy coating so it will resist occasional water exposure
this also means it biodegrades more slowly than some other tree wraps
cons: If the product is exposed to excessive water, it may slide down the trunk

customer_reviews.title: Sapling Saver
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I’ve been looking for. None of our local garden centers seem to carry it anymore. We have three young trees that we planted in the spring and they are too young to take our Colorado winter sun and weather without severely damaging the bark. I’m so happy I found this product!
customer_reviews.author: COMom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Deer had been rubbing against the bark of two young oak trees. Since wrapping the trunks, I have seen no more evidence of this. The wrap has held in place through heavy rain and wind.
customer_reviews.author: F D

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, does not seem to hold up as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This wraps nicely but seems to be coming apart somewhat quickly. I've had to reapply this after 3 weeks by unwrapping and re-wrapping the tree. It looks good when placed on the tree and may protect this winter when as it slides down the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I should have heeded the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, this wrap not great. I have used other trunk wraps before...this is sub-par. Installed it carefully, pulling it as tight as possible without tearing (that happened twice, it is no very strong) After the first rain in was sagging and gaping at multiple points.
customer_reviews.author: NAK

customer_reviews.title: They should include some type of tie with this to prevent it from becoming unraveled.
customer_reviews.text: The product is good but it is difficult to secure it to prevent it from unraveling. It would be nice if they included some type of tie with it.
customer_reviews.author: Secret

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product and great service! Product could be improved with a better differentiation of the waxed and non-waxed surfaces, perhaps something as simple as a small printed stripe.
customer_reviews.author: robert canterbury

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how well this will work
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to do everything I can to help my trees cope with our spotted lantern fly invasion. I have wrapped the trunks for the winter. The remaining wrap will be greased with Vaseline in spring to catch the hatchlings
customer_reviews.author: Mara V Obelcz

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase for one tree 7” in diameter. I did have to use duct tape to hold it together at the end. I used this on a cherry blossom tree to prevent birds from pecking on the bark.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Wrap your new tree for the winter cold!
customer_reviews.text: Great wrap for our new tree. Secured and will remove in spring. Thick and easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Holds up great to weather, heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really good. The paper is heavy in weight and thickness. We didn't have any degradation over a pretty wet and windy winter. Will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: We wrapped and it fell. We re-wrapped a different way and it fell. Other tape has stayed. Dont know what the deal was.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Ledtke

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: it does the job it is supposed to, what more can I ask of it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Solid biodegrandable tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well to protect a newly planted tree in winter. I wanted something environmentally friendly. I covered the tree at the end of October and it's been two months and the wrap is holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: A&P

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok but real answer will be in spring thaw.
customer_reviews.text: Easy Wrapping secured with plastic zip ties. After a month the wrap started slipping off.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Goes on easy and seems like it will do a good job protecting my tree against winter bark split.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware-You will unravel!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! Lasted less than a week. I have wrapped trees every year using white wrapping. Thought this brown would look better. Every tree wrap has peeled away except where it was taped. Would have to tape the entire tree! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Suckow

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped up our trees as directed. Seems to be a good product. We will see how it holds up over the winter, but it looks/feels like they same we used last year with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: A review about paper tree wrap may seem strange but this product is just what I needed to keep the buck deer from damaging my small crab apple trees.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Good paper wrap
customer_reviews.text: Nice thickness and easy to work with, happy it's available on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and wrap the trunks. Time will tell if it makes a difference with our lemon tree and bottle brush tree.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Rugaard

customer_reviews.title: Wraps easy
customer_reviews.text: Seems to wrap easy , will see how it holds up by this spring
customer_reviews.author: D. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: nice stuff. Slightly stretch
customer_reviews.text: Hey, nice stuff. Slightly stretch, not too stiff, and adequately thick.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C.

customer_reviews.title: was a good weight of paper
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing fancy in a paper roll, but it did the job, was a good weight of paper, and got here fast. I live at 8600 ft altitude trying to grow Apple trees, so this is part of my fall garden prep.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn L

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for affordable price. I have used it to protect my apricot tree, and it worked very well. Easy to use, and environment friendly. Will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far this wrap is great! Very sturdy and feels pretty thick
customer_reviews.text: So far this wrap is great! Very sturdy and feels pretty thick. Seems to be as good as the other popular brand and costs less. Looking forward to see how it holds up to the wind and snow during the winter. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to apply on tree. We will know how well it worked next spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I expected and wrapped nicely. Not sure yet how it will hold up ...
customer_reviews.text: What I expected and wrapped nicely. Not sure yet how it will hold up over the winter but it seems like it will do its job of prevent My sun scortch on our tree.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions precisely, started from the bottom of the tree and worked upwards as tight as I could without tearing it, leaving a 2" overlap. It looked great - then it rained and the wrap stretched out and began to slide down the trunk. The only way this wrap will stay up in the rain is to secure it with masking tape and zip ties every so many inches. Too much work.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. It helps to keep my plant safe from frost.
customer_reviews.author: fabian  okoye

customer_reviews.title: Love it for what you are using
customer_reviews.text: Love it for what you are using. But make sure you have cotton under it on the tree before you add the sticky stuff. If you don't the rain will make it sag and you will look like your decorating for Christmas with canker worm ribbon on your trees.
customer_reviews.author: T Gonter

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as long as it never gets wet.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Standard tree tape, but the paper product stretched and bulged after getting wet from our sprinkler system. Started to unravel within a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A

product_meta.title: HORT Paper Tree Wrap 3" x 50' roll, Commercial Grade
product_meta.description: HORT WRAP tree wrap is a biodegradable and stretchable paper wrap that helps prevent frost, windburn, and sun scald damage to trees. One side of the paper is treated with a non-toxic coating that prevents water from penetrating. The coating is effective even when the paper appears wet. Large coreless rolls provide a convenience to commercial users and contractors. HORT WRAP is 100% biodegradable. Install by wrapping the product around the trunk of the tree tightly by stretching the product as you wrap. Overlap the wrap by 2 inches as you wrap the trunk. Secure the ending of the wrap with tape or tie to prevent the wrap from unraveling from the tree. Single season use.
feature_bullets: Strong Commercial Grade - Used by Professionals
Large Coreless rolls - convenient/no waste - 100% Biodegradable
Wax coating provides a water resistant seal
Manufactured in the USA - 3" x 50' Roll

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars96 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
